page.title: 13SOCIAL CONCERNS 1.
page.content: One of the most worrying aspects of living on Digmoor is the vandalism. The empty houses have become a natural target and many have had their windows broken. Freshly painted woodwork on homes seems to encourage the ever increasing numbers of graffiti artists. The shops have been forced to put bars on their windows and many are boarded up altogether. This all presents a depressing sight to the onlooker. The estate also has an untidy appearance due to the litter which abounds. Many of the residents have lost heart because they feel they are fighting a losing battle. The general feeling is that more bins are required and a more regular road sweeping service.
